overview: This is a mixed instrumental and vocal ensemble of 12–20 members that performs music of the Renaissance.
Instruments for the players will be made available from the University’s instrument collection.

This subject is co-taught with MUSI10206 Medieval and Renaissance Ensemble 2, and MUSI30261 Medieval and Renaissance Ensemble 2. Students cannot simultaneously enrol in co-taught subjects in the same study period.
intended learning outcomes: show technical development as ensemble musicians;
participate with ability and self-confidence as a team member of a performing group;
perform selected repertoire to concert standard;
identify and exhibit specific knowledge of a range of ensemble repertoire;
exhibit an informed respect for the values and principles of ensemble performance.

assessments.description: Attendance and active participation in all rehearsals and classes. 25 hours (of work required)
Participation in performances as directed. 25 hours (of work required)
Hurdle requirement:. Students must attend 100% of all scheduled classes, rehearsals and performances as directed.

Semester 2.Contact hours: 24 hours, comprising two 1-hour rehearsals per week

Prescribed texts: There are no specifically prescribed or recommended texts for this subject.
